body: I have the same error! I'm using the latest beta and Ubuntu 64-bit, mounting acd it works for some time then it became unresponsive. But if I try rclone lsd acd:/ it shows me the root folder!! Thanks and I hope that you can help us

I thought I'd fixed that issue... I think it is caused by transferring big files greater than the temp link threshold.

I wonder it is was reintroduced by go 1.8 which changed something in that area.

So what size are the files that give the error?
It seems to be related to filesize indeed. I tested a 2GB file and it worked, while a 5 GB file gave me the error mentioned before.
In my case actually after sometimes the mount option stop working, but looking at the log I got the same error as OP! Please help me

I have an idea what is happening here - can you try using `--acd-templink-threshold 0` and see if that works around the problem?

What I think is happening is that files above a certain size are being redirected - but rclone is supplying the `Authorization` header on redirect.  I fixed this problem for the templink case already so the above might be a work around.  If it does work around the problem I know how to fix it properly.

OMG thank you! You just saved me days of work!

And also thank you so much for creating this amazing tool in the first place.
I'm going to re-open this as I need to fix it properly!
having the same problem, copying files from acd to gdrive, version: rclone v1.38 linux/amd64 .. `--acd-templink-threshold 0` workaround seems to have helped

Encountered this problem with the stable version too; the beta is working in practice and returning:
> DEBUG : Removing Authorization: header after redirect to S3

I'm guessing that's all good?
@valentine yes that is working now. Thanks for testing.

issue.title: WebDAV - Enable RFC4437 - Follow Redirect Reference Resource

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-)

So you've got an idea to improve rclone? We love that! You'll be glad to hear we've incorporated hundreds of ideas from contributors already.

Here is a checklist of things to do:

  1. Please search the old issues first for your idea and +1 or comment on an existing issue if possible.
  2. Discuss on the forum first: https://forum.rclone.org/
  3. Make a feature request issue (this is the right place!).
  4. Be prepared to get involved making the feature :-)

Looking forward to your great idea!

The Rclone Developers

-->


#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?
rclone v1.43.1
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.11


#### What problem are you are trying to solve?
I am unable to copy files from a WebDAV server which is returning 302 response followed by a Location header. The WebDAV server (Apache-Coyote/1.1) has RFC4437 enabled which describes the WebDAV behavior. In my example, the location is an AWS S3 bucket (not another location on the WebDAV server).


#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?
When the endpoint returns 302 Found, rclone cannot actually "retrieve" the file without following the 302 to the new location.
